hints.content: The area is the number of $1 \times 1$ squares the shape covers.

Let's count the number of squares covered.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A shape with 16 sides made up of 13 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: 1 square to the right, 2 squares down, 1 square to the left, 1 square down, 1 square to the right, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 4 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square up, 1 square to the right, 4 squares up, 1 square to the left, 2 squares up, 2 squares to the right, and 1 square up. The squares are labeled from 1 to 13. !

question.content:
Each square in the grid is a $1 \times 1$ centimeter square.

[[☃ image 1]]

** What is the area of the shape? **

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] square centimeters

options.alt: A shape with 16 sides made up of 13 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: 1 square to the right, 2 squares down, 1 square to the left, 1 square down, 1 square to the right, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 4 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square up, 1 square to the right, 4 squares up, 1 square to the left, 2 squares up, 2 squares to the right, and 1 square up. !
